title: Over 29,000 people affected as heavy rains continue nationwide
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) reports that adverse weather conditions prevailing over the past few days have affected 18 districts across the island.

title: Trump sets 10% hike in tariffs on Canada after ad airs during World Series
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday he was increasing tariffs on Canada by an additional 10% “above what they’re paying now,” as he reacted again to an ad by Canada’s Ontario province, a day after it was aired during the World Series broadcast.

title: Three arrested over murder of Weligama PS Chairman
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has arrested three individuals today in connection with the recent murder of the Chairman of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha, Lasantha Wickramasekera.

title: Trump arrives in Malaysia for ASEAN Summit, thanks PM Ibrahim to end Cambodia-Thailand conflict
byline: US President Donald Trump arrived in Malaysia on Saturday, beginning the first of three stops on the first Asia trip of his second term.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department states that showers or thundershowers will occur at times in the Northern and North-Central Provinces and in the Trincomalee and Batticaloa Districts.

title: Cache of ammunition found in Kanadara Oya
byline: Police have recovered a stock of live ammunition used in T-56 assault rifles, along with two magazines, from the Wahamalgollewa area in Medawachchiya.

title: Sri Lanka leads South Asia in AI job growth, ranks second in ChatGPT usage: World Bank
byline: Sri Lanka has emerged as one of South Asia’s most AI-exposed economies, with strong growth in artificial intelligence–related jobs but also mounting risks of job displacement, according to the World Bank’s South Asia Development Update: Jobs, AI, and Trade (October 2025).

title: Thai, Cambodia leaders sign expanded ceasefire deal with Trump present
byline: The leaders of Thailand and Cambodia signed an enhanced ceasefire deal on Sunday in the presence of U.S. President Donald Trump, who intervened in July to bring an end to their deadly five-day border conflict.

title: Police seek public assistance to arrest suspect in Weligama PS Chairman’s murder
byline: Sri Lanka Police are seeking public assistance to arrest a suspect wanted in connection with the murder of Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman, Lasantha Wickramasekera.

title: Sri Lanka leads South Asia in AI job growth, ranks second in ChatGPT usage: World Bank
byline: Sri Lanka has emerged as one of South Asia’s most AI-exposed economies, with strong growth in artificial intelligence–related jobs but also mounting risks of job displacement, according to the World Bank’s South Asia Development Update: Jobs, AI, and Trade (October 2025).

title: Two arrested over theft of jewels at Louvre, French media report
byline: Two arrested over theft of precious jewels from Louvre museum in Paris, French media say.

title: Over 30,000 in 18 districts affected by adverse weather
byline: A total of 31,623 individuals from 7,944 families in 18 districts have been affected by prevailing adverse weather conditions in the country.

title: Navy rescues crew from distressed Merchant Vessel MV Integrity Star
byline: The crew of the Merchant Vessel MV Integrity Star which was in distress due to the failure in the main engines approximately 100 nautical miles south of Sri Lanka have been rescued by the Sri Lanka Navy.

title: India–Sri Lanka ferry service temporarily suspended
byline: The international ferry service between Nagapattinam and Kankesanthurai, Sri Lanka, has been suspended with the onset of the northeast monsoon. Operations will resume in December.

title: India and China to resume direct flights as ties improve
byline: India and China resume direct flights on Sunday (Oct 26) after a five-year suspension, a move important both for trade and a symbolic step as Asia’s giants cautiously rebuild relations.

title: Another individual linked to Weligama PS Chairman’s murder arrested
byline: Another suspect who had allegedly aided & abetted in the killing of Weligama PS Chairman Lasantha Wickramasekara arrested in Galle by the Weligama Police.

title: Indian visitors continue to dominate tourist arrival figures
byline: A total of 35,090 Indian nationals have arrived in the country thus far in the month of October, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: Nearly 28,000 individuals subjected to inspection during special police operation
byline: A total of 743 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday (25).

title: Methmi Wijesuriya wins 10,000m gold for Sri Lanka in Ranchi
byline: Sri Lanka’s Methmi Wijesuriya won the gold medal in the Women’s 10,000m event at the South Asian Athletics Championships 2025 at the Birsa Munda Athletics Stadium, Morabadi, Ranchi.

title: Suspected gunman in murder of Weligama PS Chairman arrested
byline: A man suspected to be the gunman in the murder of the Chairman of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha, Lasantha Wickramasekara has been arrested.

title: Saudi national arrested over alleged assault on flight attendants
byline: A Saudi Arabian national has been arrested by the Katunayake Airport Police in connection with an incident in which two SriLankan Airlines flight attendants were assaulted onboard an aircraft.

title: 17,000 children living under highly vulnerable conditions: Public Security Minister
byline: Around 17,000 children living under highly vulnerable conditions have been identified, Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala stated.

title: New info uncovered regarding van driver arrested for driving without obeying police orders in Ratmalana
byline: Police have uncovered several information regarding the driver of the van who was arrested yesterday (25) in Ratmalana for driving without obeying police orders.

title: Russia says it has tested nuclear-powered Burevestnik missile
byline: Russia has tested the nuclear-powered Burevestnik cruise missile, Moscow’s top general has said.

title: South Asian Athletics C’ships: Rumesh Tharanga wins gold in Men’s javelin throw
byline: Sri Lanka’s Rumesh Tharanga claimed the gold medal in the Men’s javelin throw event at the South Asian Athletics Championships 2025 at the Birsa Munda Athletics Stadium, Morabadi, Ranchi.

title: Two more suspects involved in Weligama PS Chairman’s murder arrested
byline: Two more suspects allegedly involved in the killing of the Chairman of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha, Lasantha Wickramasekara have been arrested in Galle.

title: Israeli military says it conducted ‘targeted strike’ in central Gaza
byline: Israeli forces carried out a “targeted strike” on an individual in central Gaza who was planning to attack Israeli troops, Israel’s military said on Saturday (Oct 25).

title: South Asian Athletics C’ships: Madushani Herath wins gold in Women’s Long Jump in Ranchi
byline: Sri Lanka’s Madushani Herath won the gold medal in the Women’s Long Jump at the South Asian Athletics Championships 2025 at the Birsa Munda Athletics Stadium, Morabadi, Ranchi.

title: Bollywood actor Satish Shah passes away aged 74
byline: Veteran actor Satish Shah, who is known for his comic roles in shows ‘Yeh Jo Hai Zindagi’ and ‘Sarabhai vs Sarabhai’, passed away due to Kidney failure.

title: South Asian Athletics C’ships: Harsha Karunarathne wins gold in Men’s 800m in Ranchi
byline: Sri Lanka’s Harsha Karunarathne won the gold medal in the Men’s 800m event at the South Asian Athletics Championships 2025 at the Birsa Munda Athletics Stadium, Morabadi, Ranchi.

title: South Asian Athletics C’ships: Dilhani Lekamge wins gold in Women’s javelin throw
byline: Sri Lanka’s Dilhani Lekamge claimed the gold medal in the Women’s javelin throw event at the South Asian Athletics Championships 2025 at the Birsa Munda Athletics Stadium, Morabadi, Ranchi.

title: South Asian Athletics C’ships: Safiya Yamic claims third gold by winning Women’s 200m event
byline: Sri Lanka’s Safiya Yamic won the gold medal in the Women’s 200m event at the South Asian Athletics Championships 2025 at the Birsa Munda Athletics Stadium, Morabadi, Ranchi.

title: South Asian Athletics C’ships: Dasuni Kaushalya wins gold in Women’s 400m Hurdles in Ranchi
byline: Sri Lanka’s Dasuni Kaushalya won the gold medal in the Women’s 400m Hurdles event at the South Asian Athletics Championships 2025 at the Birsa Munda Athletics Stadium, Morabadi, Ranchi.

title: Suspects arrested over Weligama PS Chairman’s murder handed over to FCID
byline: The suspected gunman and several others arrested in relation to the murder of the Chairman of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha, Lasantha Wickramasekara have been handed over to the Financial Crimes Investigation Division, police stated.

title: US and China agree on trade framework ahead of leaders’ meeting
byline: Top Chinese and US economic officials agreed on the framework for a trade agreement on Sunday (Oct 26) as US President Donald Trump said he was confident of hashing out a deal with Chinese President Xi Jinping when they meet in the coming days.

title: Sri Lanka finish second at South Asian Athletics Championships
byline: Sri Lanka finished second at the fourth South Asian Senior Athletics Championships held in Ranchi India.

title: Sri Lanka secures silver in Boys’ Medley Relay event at Asian Youth Games
byline: Sri Lanka secured the silver medal in the Boys’ Medley Relay event at the 3rd Asian Youth Games in Bahrain today.

title: 2025 Asia Youth Games: Dilni Rajapaksha wins Bronze in Girl’s Triple Jump event
byline: Sri Lanka’s Dilni Rajapaksha won the bronze in the Girl’s Triple Jump event at the third Asia Youth Games 2025 in Bahrain.

title: South Asian Athletics C’ships: Sri Lanka secures gold in Men’s 4x400m relay
byline: Sri Lanka won the gold medal in the Men’s 4x400m relay event at the South Asian Athletics Championships 2025 at the Birsa Munda Athletics Stadium, Morabadi, Ranchi.
